dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 3952 IH: To limit the flags that may be flown over a facility of the Department of Veterans Affairs.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Bost (for himself, Mr. Self, Mr. Grothman, Mr. Ezell, Mr. Westerman, Mr. Duncan, Mrs. Luna, Mr. Rosendale, Mr. Loudermilk, Mr. Austin Scott of Georgia, Mr. Guest, Mr. Kelly of Mississippi, Mr. Bean of Florida, Mrs. Miller-Meeks, Mr. Bergman, Mr. Balderson, Mr. Crane, Mr. Huizenga, and Mr. C. Scott Franklin of Florida) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs

form.official-title: To limit the flags that may be flown over a facility of the Department of Veterans Affairs.

section.header: Limitation of flags that may be flown over a facility of the Department of Veterans Affairs

subsection.text: The only flags that may be flown over a facility of the Department of Veterans Affairs are the following:

paragraph.text: The flag of the United States.
The flag of an Indian Tribal government.
The flag of an Armed Force.
The term State means each of the several States, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands, Guam, American Samoa, and the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands.

The term Indian Tribal government means the governing body of any Indian or Alaska Native Tribe, band, nation, pueblo, village, or community that the Secretary of the Interior acknowledges to exist as an Indian Tribe under the Federally Recognized Indian Tribe List Act of 1994 (25 U.S.C. 5130 et seq.).
